thread.title: Shanghai FA reject claims that either Shenhua or SIPG have made an approach for Wayne Rooney
thread.title_full: Shanghai FA reject claims that either Shenhua or SIPG have made an approach for Wayne Rooney

author: James Whaling
title: Shanghai FA reject claims that either Shenhua or SIPG have made an approach for Wayne Rooney
text:
Shanghai FA reject claims that either Shenhua or SIPG have made an approach for Wayne Rooney England skipper Rooney has been linked with a £500,000-a-week move to the Far East Share Rooney was reportedly the subject of a big-money offer from China (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Shanghai FA have rejected claims that either of their clubs in the Chinese Super League have made an offer to sign Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney. 
England skipper Rooney has been linked with a £500,000-a-week move to the Far East to potentially link up with former Old Trafford strike partner Carlos Tevez at Shanghai Shenhua. 
The 31-year-old has fallen down the pecking order at Old Trafford under Jose Mourinho, being used from the bench more often than not with Zlatan Ibrahimovic preferred from the start. 
But Rooney is still club captain at the Red Devils and became United's all-time top goal scorer with a stunning stoppage-time free-kick to rescue a point at Stoke on Saturday. Wayne Rooney under pressure from GHull City's Harry Maguire and Michael Dawson (Photo: Getty Images) HULL, ENGLAND - JANUARY 26: Wayne Rooney of Manchester United (2L) jokes on the bench with team mates Marouane Fellaini (L), Henrikh Mkhitaryan (2R) and Juan Mata (R) the EFL Cup Semi-Final second leg match between Hull City and Manchester United at KCOM Stadium on January 26, 2017 in Hull, England. (Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images) (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
And authorities in Shanghai say, to their knowledge, but Shenhua and SIPG have completed their transfer business. 
"For all we know, both Shanghai clubs in the CSL [Shanghai Shenhua and Shanghai SIPG] have finished their transfer business and there is no vacancy for foreign players whatsoever," the Shanghai FA said in a statement.
